answers.answer: If its at such high risk they should be checking u more now rather than later. I'm at high risk and my dr. Started checking every two weeks since I was about 26 weeks. But as long as u feel ur baby move dont worry to much its weird they would tell that just like that.

Ill be praying for u and ur baby but really if u feel thr baby moving and its all ok with u so far dont think anything will happen keep positive toughts sometimes I feel as if drs. Scare u more than they should.
Thanks I did find it weird too. I feel my baby move a lot. Iam not going worrie to much n thank you again.
Yea as long as the baby moving your fine just monitor your diet... what are your glucose numbers
You n ur baby will in my prayers but ur feeling ur baby moving n that's a great thing hun...
Yeah if it's high risk and they're really concerned they'd be seeing you more. I'm 25 weeks and go every week to get checked bc I'm high risk...
They be 275 sometime 300 the Lowes I got down to was 119

I am diabetic and 34wks. I've been on weekly visits thru out pregnancy and am now on biweekly nst appointments. I am on glyburide 2.5mg 2x a day and have to be really strict with my diet. I was terrified at first cause of the risks to baby. I had a long discussion with my ob dr, a perinatal specialist, and a pediatrician.  Risk of stillborn is mostly if you go past 38wks and levels are not strictly controlled. Hence why inductions or c-section are scheduled more for diabetics. My drs were/are more concerned with babys sugar level dropping quickly once the umbilical cord is cut and her body being able to adjust. Also diabetes makes babies tend to be larger. (We are measuring 2weeks ahead n 6lbs12oz, mind u that can be up to a lb off) keep an open dialogue with your drs about your concerns. Keep close track of your levels, for me I stay under 90fasting and 120 2hours after eating. Its hard especially with prego cravings but focus on today today and tomorrow tomorrow. That's how I've done it and its helped. Good luck

Are you regular diabetic or gestational? What's your fasting level and how soon are you testing after eating? Not trying to be nosy and butt in your business but levels at 275, 300 are really serious. What med have they put u on? Levels like that will require insulin and possible hospital stays to get it down and can cause pregnancy loss. Not trying to scare or upset you, just let you know my experience and what I have learned going thru a pregnancy loss due to extremely high sugar levels and how I what changes and things I have gone thru to have a healthy (as possible) pregnancy and healthy baby.
You better b really careful it happened to me lost my baby day before i was spose to deliver im a very bad diabetic so please control your sugar goodluck
